headline: Stablecoin Rewards Resemble Traditional Loyalty Programs, Says Circle CEO
summary: The annual payouts on stablecoins offered by crypto platforms are similar in nature to loyalty and reward programs found in traditional products, Circle Internet Group Chief Executive Jeremy Allaire said on Thursday.  “Our view is we are talking about some different interests, navigating specific language around rewards systems, [that] seems like a solvable problem.”

raw.headline: Stablecoin Rewards Resemble Traditional Loyalty Programs, Says Circle CEO
raw.summary: The annual payouts on stablecoins offered by crypto platforms are similar in nature to loyalty and reward programs found in traditional products, Circle Internet Group Chief Executive Jeremy Allaire said on Thursday.  “Our view is we are talking about some different interests, navigating specific language around rewards systems, [that] seems like a solvable problem.”

headline: Should Israel’s Opening to App-Based Ride Hailing Require Action From Lyft (LYFT) Investors?
summary: An Israeli ministerial committee has approved a bill that would allow ride-hailing platforms such as Lyft and Uber to operate in Israel, creating a formal regulatory framework for app-based services aimed at increasing transportation supply and lowering costs; the proposal now awaits full parliamentary approval following this past committee decision. For Lyft, the move is material because it opens the door to a new national market where regulatory access has historically been restricted,...

headline: Transports Hit New Highs—A Bullish Signal for the Market
summary: The Dow Transports are making new highs alongside the Dow Industrials. Historically, that’s been a bullish setup for U.S. stocks.

headline: Why Uber Is Letting AI Use “Common Sense” in Customer Service
summary: Dara Khosrowshahi, Uber CEO, speaks with WSJ Leadership Institute President Alan Murray on why Uber is scrapping rigid rule-based systems and empowering AI to make judgment calls. Khosrowshahi says that AI guided by context and “common sense” can deliver a better customer service experience rather than sticking to a rigid rule book.

headline: Uber CEO Warns The 'Biggest Factor' In AV Growth Is Affordability, As Significant Scaling Could Take 10-20 Years
summary: Uber Technologies Inc. (NYSE:UBER) CEO Dara Khosrowshahi highlighted the key factors influencing the growth of autonomous vehicles. High Costs Slow AV Adoption Speaking at the World Economic Forum, Davos, on Tuesday, Khosrowshahi emphasized the critical role of affordability in the expansion of autonomous vehicles. headline: The Bull Case For Uber Technologies (UBER) Could Change Following Nationwide Kroger Grocery Rollout Onto Uber Apps
summary: In mid-January 2026, Uber Technologies and The Kroger Co. rolled out nearly 2,700 Kroger Family of Companies stores onto the Uber Eats, Uber, and Postmates apps, giving customers nationwide access to full-store grocery assortments with on-demand and same-day delivery. This expansion deepens Uber’s presence in grocery delivery while reinforcing its role as a broader everyday shopping platform rather than only a restaurant marketplace. Next, we’ll examine how this nationwide Kroger rollout...
